notes: High doses of omega-3 (>3g/day) increase vitamin E requirement due to oxidation; most fish oil supplements are fortified with vitamin E
High folate (>1000mcg/day) can mask B12 deficiency anemia while neurological damage continues; always monitor B12 status when taking high-dose folate
Contains monacolin K (natural lovastatin) which depletes CoQ10 similar to statin drugs; consider CoQ10 supplementation (100-200mg/day)
High-dose vitamin A (>10000 IU/day) can interfere with vitamin D function as both compete for absorption and receptor binding
Very high doses (>2000mg/day) may reduce copper absorption; generally mild effect; less significant than zinc-copper interaction
Vitamin D requires magnesium for activation; magnesium deficiency impairs vitamin D metabolism; ensure adequate magnesium intake
High doses (>400 IU/day) interfere with vitamin K function and increase bleeding risk; particularly dangerous with anticoagulants like warfarin
Zinc >50mg/day competes with copper absorption; long-term high-dose zinc supplementation causes copper deficiency (anemia neutropenia neurological issues)
Zinc competes with iron for absorption via shared transporters; take separately (at least 2 hours apart) if supplementing both
High-dose zinc and calcium compete for absorption; separate doses if taking >50mg zinc and >500mg calcium
